title.narrative: FoodTechAfrica: Sustainable aquaculture best practices in Tanzania

description.narrative: The aquaculture sector in Tanzania has great potential. This is due to the growing demand for locally produced fish, growth of the population and swiftly declining local supply from wild catch. These combined factors have been driving up fish prices and increase of fish imports. However, the aquaculture sector has not unlocked its potential as it lacks proven examples, best practices, practical knowledge and skills, technology and quality inputs. This impact cluster intents to solve these challenges by demonstrating a highly efficient, land-based fish farm system in a nucleus demonstration setting (“the aquahub”). This will serve as the nucleus where expertise and best practice come together. By demonstrating the RAS methodology, the cluster aims to show the business case to Tanzanian entrepreneurs that may operate aquaculture as a business and trigger investment and development of the sector. Moreover the project also entails an extensive training program for the staff of the farm and extension officers who will in their turn provide training and demonstration activities to further develop the sector.

title.narrative: Report FoodTech Africa Impact Cluster – Aquaculture Tanzania
Private Sector Development (PSD)

description.narrative: Business development, by investment or trade of local or Dutch companies with(in) low and middle income countries

title.narrative: Number of direct jobs supported in individually supported SME by PSD programmes - Total

comment.narrative: Partners Genap Lattice Consulting and Big Fish all employ staff in East Africa BV Genap has a joint venture company in Kenya, called Maji Water Storage, through which it supplies the Tanzanian aquaculture market with tanks and liners Maji currently has a team of eight staff www majiwaterstorage com Lattice Consulting is the Larive Group member for East Africa and has its headquaters in Nairobi, Kenya Currently Lattice has a team of ten people Big Fish operates two production facilities Korogwe and Kigamboni and a fish trade shop ( In total, the company employs 20 full time and 2 part time staff. The total number of jobs supported is 40

comment.narrative: Aquaculture Working Group In parallel with the Impact Cluster project, the Netherlands Embassy in Tanzania has initiated the Aquaculture Working Group ( The group consists of all key aquaculture private sector and public sector stakeholders in Tanzania and has the aim to foster better cooperation and share sector insights Partners of the AWG Embassy of The Kingdom of the Netherlands ( EKN)( public) Ministry of Livestock Fisheries ( public) Tanzania Fisheries Research Institute ( TAFIRI)( public) Fisheries Education and Training Agency ( FETA)( public) Big Fish Safina LtD ( private) SAGCOT Center LtD ( public) Aquaculture Association of Tanzania ( AAT)( private) FoodTechAfrica ( Larive International ( private) Sokoine University of Agriculture ( public)

comment.narrative: As a result of the project, Big Fish has become the main distributor of Nutreco fish feeds in Tanzania, partner in training and on farm trials. As a result of the project, Big Fish has become the main distributor of Nutreco fish feeds in Tanzania, partner in training and on farm trials. Big Fish has become the main distributor for Nutreco
